page.title: 11Bridges
page.content:
In a very flat land with many waterways, bridges assume a special improtance in the life of local inhabitants.
A pupil writes: I live quite near a bridge. The river is called the New Cut. The sides of the bridge are made of metal and they are very bumpy. The sides are painted green and grey and it looks very nice. The bridge is made of bricks and concrete.
Sometimes a heavy lorry goes over the bridge and bangs into it. There is a path on each side of the bridge, and drains too. A lot of people and bikes go over it. My dad has to go over it every morning to work. My grandad helped build another nearby bridge.
